title: Objective
description: A description of the microscope's objective lens. Required elements include the lens numerical aperture, and the magnification, both of which a floating point (real) numbers. The values are those that are fixed for a particular objective: either because it has been manufactured to this specification or the value has been measured on this particular objective. Correction: This is the type of correction coating applied to this lens. Immersion: This is the types of immersion medium the lens is designed to work with. It is not the same as 'Medium' in ObjectiveRef (a single type) as here Immersion can have compound values like 'Multi'. LensNA: The numerical aperture of the lens (as a float) NominalMagnification: The specified magnification e.g. x10 CalibratedMagnification: The measured magnification e.g. x10.3 WorkingDistance: WorkingDistance of the lens

Name.description: A user defined name for this component.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Correction.description: The correction applied to the lens.

NominalMagnification.description: The magnification of the lens as specified by the manufacturer - i.e. 60 represents a 60X lens.

CalibratedMagnification.description: The magnification of the lens as measured by a calibration process- i.e. '59.987' for a 60X lens.

LensNA.description: The numerical aperture of the lens expressed as a floating point (real) number. Expected range 0.02 - 1.5.

NominalImmersionMedium.description: The immersion medium the lens is designed for.

Infinity.description: Records whether or not the objective is infinity corrected.

WorkingDistance.description: The working distance of the lens expressed as a floating point (real) number.

Iris.description: Records whether or not the objective was fitted with an Iris.

ObjectiveFieldNumber.description: The maximal diameter of the viewfield allowed by this objective expressed in mm and measured at the intermediate image plane. NB: The field of view is influenced by the magnification and diameter of the ocular (eyepiece) field diaphragm, but also by the limits imposed by the design of the objective.

ParfocalizingDistance.description: The distance between the objective lens mounting plane and the specimen.

BackFocalPlanePosition.description: The position of the back focal plane with respect to the specimen position.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of this component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of this component

SpecsFile.description: Provide the location of a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: The AnnotationRef element is a reference to an element derived from the CommentAnnotation element, which consists of a simple comment multi-line annotation.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
